intro: Chaetogastra grossa, commonly known as the roughleaf chaetogastra, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its flowering stems are often branched and bear numerous tiny, inconspicuous blooms. Chaetogastra grossa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
